required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Guiding Catheter on FFR and NHPR for the Assessment of Coronary Artery Stenoses (Disengage@Rest)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Guiding Catheter on Fractional Flow Reserve and Non-Hyperemic Pressure Ratios for the Assessment of Coronary Artery Stenoses - Disengage @Rest

brief_summary.textblock: The DISENGAGE@rest study is a prospective registry carried out at Federico II University of Naples with the aim to evaluate the influence of the guiding catheter engagement within the coronary ostium on both FFR and non-hyperaemic pressure ratios values (such as Pd/Pa and the Resting Full-cycle Ratio -RFR), as well as the corresponding clinical impact on decision-making strategies. Consecutive patients with at least one intermediate stenosis (40%-90% by visual estimation) in any of the 3 main coronary arteries will be included.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences between FFR before and after guiding catheter disengagement
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the influence of the guiding catheter engagement within the coronary ostium on FFR values.

primary_outcome.measure: 1. Differences between NHPR before and after guiding catheter disengagement
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the influence of the guiding catheter engagement within the coronary ostium on NHPR values

intervention.description: Comparison between FFR and NHPR before and after guiding catheter disengagement

study_pop.textblock: Patient > 18 years old with coronary artery disease and indication to perform functional assessment
